lesson_objectives: <gcb-youtube videoid="1ppwmxidyIE" instanceid="JabvZDhBcY5U"></gcb-youtube>
• Apply the strategy of color filtering to find information quickly.

• Recognize ads on a search engine results page.
  • Describe how the order of results on a page is determined.
• Select effective keywords: words you predict will be in your results, important words, and synonyms when appropriate.
• Identify the factors that have an effect on search queries.

lesson_title: Finding text on a web page
lesson_objectives: • Use Control-F to quickly find text on a page.

lesson_title: When search results suggest something new
lesson_objectives: • Utilize information in Knowledge Graph panels, Instant results, Suggestions, and Related Searches when they appear.

lesson_title: Thinking more deeply about your search
lesson_objectives:
• Recognize when search results are offering information that suggests a better/additional search.
  • Use 'define' to identify the meaning of words.
  • Use dictionary mode to define words that do not appear in traditional dictionaries.

• Use image search when it appears in search results, and use related image search to refine results.
  • Refine results by using different media types like videos and news.

lesson_title: Reading the Search Engine Results Page (SERP)
lesson_objectives:
• Use the page preview tool to preview results pages.
  • Identify the parts of a search engine result: title, web address, and snippet/abstract.
  • Use links within the search engine results to go directly to a sub-page of the site.
  • Use the site: operator to restrict results to a domain, website, or directory.
  • Interpret a search engine results page.
• Find different kinds of content efficiently: blogs, discussions, recipes, patents, books, 3D models, scholarly sources, and legal documents.

• Describe how operators filter results.
  • Use the site: operator at the top-level domain and website levels.
  • Use a word you expect to appear on the target page to refine results.
  • Use the site: operator within images and news results.

• Use the filetype: operator to find and download different kinds of documents.
  • Combine operators to refine searches.
• Use the minus sign to eliminate irrelevant results.

• Use quotes to search for a phrase.
  • Use OR to include more than one way of expressing an idea.

• Use the intext: operator to ensure the word you want is actually on the page you find.
  • Use the Advanced Search user interface when appropriate.
• Identify an image with Search by Image.
• Find facts quickly with shortcuts (search features).
• Calculate math expressions and conversions from the search box.

lesson_title: Left hand panel and Date range limiting
lesson_objectives: • Limit results to sources from a specific time period.

• Translate words, sentences, and pages.
  • Search pages in foreign languages using English.
• Verify the credibility of information you find.
• Avoid confirmation bias when conducting searches.

lesson_title: Using Books to verify a quote
lesson_objectives: • Search appropriate sources that offer authoritative information for the type of information you are trying to find.

lesson_title: Using WHOIS and looking for other site information
lesson_objectives: • Use WHOIS to identify who owns a particular website.
• Distinguish between the Google products that indicate credibility and those that do not.
• Combine operators for stronger searches.

• Combine methods and approaches to find information efficiently.
  • Conduct research effectively with tools that are not traditionally used for research.
• Identify ways to continue learning how to be an effective searcher.
